Item.Name: Button
Item.Description: Rendered as a straight element. Hook up a |sHtml|script|eHtml| to a button click event and make your page do stuff.

Item.Name: Checkbox
Item.Description: Capture a True or False input from a user.

Item.Name: CheckboxList
Item.Description: A Check box list renders a list of options and allows user to select multiple values.

Item.Name: DataGrid
Item.Description: Datagrids are rendered as tables with column ordering. Optionally these can also have a search box and an export button. Clicking the export button pushes the data into a CSV file and prompts the user to download it.

Item.Name: DatePicker
Item.Description: For the Stadium5 datepicker, we use the standard |sHtml|JQuery-UI .datepicker()|eHtml| with some CSS tweaks.

Item.Name: DropDown
Item.Description: This renders as a standard <select></select> tag containing <option></option> tags.

Item.Name: Image
Item.Description: Display a pre-chosen image to the user.

Item.Name: Label
Item.Description: A label renders as a set of <span> tags.

Item.Name: Layout%20Grid
Item.Description: Layout Grid is based on the 12 column bootsrap grid and allows you to create columns on your page for precise layout.

Item.Name: Layout%20Table
Item.Description: You can use the Table control to layout other controls and apply consistent spacing.

Item.Name: Link
Item.Description: A link renders as a set of <a /> tag. In order to add some behaviour to the page, you can attach a script to the click event.

Item.Name: Menu
Item.Description: A menu renders as an unordered list. It can be displayed top-to-bottom menu or left-to-right multi-level drop-down menu.

Item.Name: Panel
Item.Description: A panel renders as a <fieldset /> tag. You can place items into the panel to group them.

Item.Name: RadioButtonList
Item.Description: A Check box list renders a list of options and allows user to select one value.

Item.Name: TextBox
Item.Description: A textbox renders as a set of <textarea /> tag with the height of a single line input.

Item.Name: UploadFile
Item.Description: An upload file renders as a <form /> tag containing an <input type="file" /> tag and a <button /> tag. The functionality for uploading the file is already built into the control. All you need to do is set the control properties.
